intro: Bakerella microcuspis, commonly known as the small-cusped bakerella, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants such as buckwheat and knotweed. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Bakerella microcuspis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks.
